Aquí tienes el guion para teleprompter, diseñado específicamente para ser leído en un tono sarcástico, autoritario y ligeramente "snob", propio de un experto que mira con desdén la cultura moderna pero que aporta datos científicos irrefutables.

Está formateado en inglés, como solicitaste, listo para copiar y pegar en tu software de teleprompter.

***

# THE SONIC LOBOTOMY: HOW WE DEVOLVED FROM STARDUST TO TIKTOK

* [SCENE START]
* [VIDEO STARTS PLAYING THE "MODERN POP/REGGAETON" TRACK GENERATED BY SUNO]

<audio controls>
  involution.mp3
  Tu navegador no soporta la reproducción de audio.
</audio>

* [LOUD, REPETITIVE, COMPRESSED BEAT PLAYS FOR 8 SECONDS. VISUALS OF FAST-PACED TIKTOK DANCES OR FLASHING LIGHTS]

* [NARRATOR SUDDENLY APPEARS ON SCREEN, LOOKING TERRIFIED. WAVING HANDS TO CUT THE MUSIC]

Stop! Stop it immediately!

* [MUSIC CUTS TO ABRUPT SILENCE]

Are you trying to kill them?

* [NARRATOR LOOKS DIRECTLY AT THE CAMERA, ADJUSTING SUIT/TIE, REGAINING COMPOSURE]

Apologies, ladies and gentlemen. Do not click away. That was a test. A safety drill.

If you had listened to that loop for thirty more seconds, your prefrontal cortex would have begun to dissolve into a warm, sugary sludge. We call that "modern culture."

But you are here because you suspect something, don't you? You suspect that music used to be... smart.

Well, you are right. And today, I am going to show you exactly how humanity went from listening to the mind of God to listening to a computerized washing machine.

Welcome to the history of your own cognitive decline.

# BLOCK 1: THE MATHEMATICAL SOUL

Let’s go back. Way back. Before autotune, before "branding," before music was a product to sell sneakers.

Let's go to Mesopotamia, 3,400 years ago.

* [PLAY SUNO TRACK: "THE DIVINE ORIGIN" - SUMERIAN STYLE]
* [VISUALS: CUNEIFORM TABLETS, SACRED GEOMETRY]

You hear that? That isn't entertainment. That is data.

The Sumerians and the Greeks didn't use music to shake their hips. They used it to align their souls with the cosmos.

Pythagoras, the man you hated in math class, discovered that beauty wasn't an opinion. It was a ratio. 2 to 1. 3 to 2. The Tetraktys.

They believed that if you tuned an instrument perfectly, you could heal a body. If you tuned it wrong... well, you got chaos.

They treated sound as a branch of astronomy and mathematics. Today, we treat it as a background noise for selling insurance.

Evolution? I don't think so.

# BLOCK 2: THE COSMIC MOTET

Now, let's fast forward to the 17th Century. Johannes Kepler.

* [PLAY SUNO TRACK: "COSMIC POLYPHONY" - KEPLER STYLE]
* [VISUALS: KEPLER’S GEOMETRIC MODELS OF THE SOLAR SYSTEM]

Kepler didn't just look at the planets; he listened to them. He believed the universe was a six-voice polyphonic motet.

He actually calculated the notes for each planet. Do you know what Earth sings?

"Mi, Fa, Mi."

Kepler said it stood for "Miseria et Fames." Misery and Famine. Even in 1619, the Earth was the emo kid of the solar system.

But listen to the complexity. This music demands that your brain solves a puzzle. It forces you to track independent lines of thought simultaneously. It is mental gymnastics.

And then... humanity reached the peak.

# BLOCK 3: THE ARCHITECTURE OF GOD (THE BAROQUE)

* [PLAY SUNO TRACK: "THE BAROQUE PEAK" - BACH STYLE]
* [VISUALS: FRACTALS, BAROQUE CATHEDRALS, BRAIN SCANS LIGHTING UP]

This. This is the pinnacle. The Baroque.

Composers like J.S. Bach didn't write music to get famous on Instagram. They wrote music to structure the human mind.

This is not just "pretty." It is scientific engineering.

Listen to that tempo. It is approximately 60 beats per minute. Do you know what else beats at 60 times per minute?

A relaxed human heart.

Science tells us that listening to this specific rhythm induces Alpha waves in the brain. It physically forces you to calm down and focus.

A study from the University of Maryland showed that radiologists who listened to Baroque music became more efficient and precise in their diagnoses.

Think about that. Baroque music makes you smarter. It organizes your thoughts. It uses the "Doctrine of the Affections" to engineer your emotions with surgical precision.

It connects you to the "numinous"—that feeling of being small in a vast, orderly universe. It kills your ego.

And sadly... the ego is the only thing modern society wants to feed.

# BLOCK 4: THE GREAT COLLAPSE

So, what happened? How did we fall from the architecture of angels?

We invented the industry.

* [PLAY SUNO TRACK: "THE INVOLUTION" - MODERN POP LOOP]
* [VISUALS: CHARTS OF THE "MILLION SONG DATASET", FLATTENED SOUND WAVES, TIKTOK SCROLLING]

Welcome to the present. The era of the "Loudness War."

A massive study by the University of Vienna analyzed half a million songs. The scientific conclusion? We are getting dumber.

Since the 1950s, the complexity of timbre and harmony has dropped by 40%.

We traded the orchestra for the loop. We traded the dynamic range—the beautiful difference between a whisper and a scream—for a solid brick of noise.

Why? Because your brain has a flaw. It’s called "subitizing." It prefers small, lazy numbers.

The industry knows that if they give you more than four chords, you might get confused. If they give you a quiet intro, you might swipe to the next video.

So they compress everything. They remove the nuance. They create a neurochemical product designed to trigger a dopamine hit in six seconds.

It is not art. It is auditory sugar. And just like sugar, it gives you a rush, and then it leaves you malnourished.

# CONCLUSION: THE SILENCE

* [CUT MUSIC ABRUPTLY. SILENCE ON SET]

And here is the tragedy.

If you cannot process a complex harmony, you probably cannot process a complex idea.

If your brain is trained to demand a hook every fifteen seconds, you will not have the patience to read a book, or understand a geopolitical conflict, or listen to a dissenting opinion.

We have raised a generation on a diet of sonic ultra-processed food. We have severed the link between music and knowledge.

* [NARRATOR LEANS IN CLOSE]

And the irony? The music you heard in this video... the "ancient" lyre, the "Baroque" masterpiece, even that terrible pop song...

I didn't write them. A human didn't write them.

An Artificial Intelligence generated them based on my prompts.

We have handed our culture over to the machines because we are too lazy to learn the math ourselves.

So, here is my advice. Turn off the radio. Find some Bach. Sit in silence for five minutes.

Reclaim your brain before the algorithm composts it.

I'm @translatedpressde. Think critically. Or at least, try to.

* [FADE TO BLACK]

***

**Nota para el editor:**
*   Las fuentes utilizadas para este guion incluyen el estudio de la Universidad de Viena (Joan Serrà et al.) sobre la simplicidad musical, los conceptos de la "Doctrina de los Afectos" y las ondas Alfa en el Barroco, y las teorías de Kepler sobre la armonía planetaria.
*   La sección legal sobre IA se aborda implícitamente en la ironía final, cumpliendo con la advertencia de que la música no tiene autor humano.
